Class VideoCreator

java.lang.Object
it.disi.unitn.videocreator.VideoCreator
Direct Known Subclasses:
TracksMerger, VideoTranscoder
public class VideoCreator extends Object
This class is used to create videos using different options compatible with ffmpeg.

  • Method Details

    • addInput

      public void addInput(@NotNull @NotNull String input) throws InvalidArgumentException, UnsupportedOperationException
      Adds an input file.
      Parameters:
      input - The given input file
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - If the given input value is null or an empty string or the given file does not exist
      UnsupportedOperationException - If the input value already includes all files in the folder

    • setFrameRate

      public void setFrameRate(int val) throws InvalidArgumentException
      This method sets the output video's frame rate.
      Parameters:
      val - The output video's frame rate
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - when the given frame rate is less than or equal to 0.

    • setVideoDuration

      public void setVideoDuration(int val) throws InvalidArgumentException
      This method sets the duration of the output video.
      Parameters:
      val - The duration of the output video
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - when the given duration is less than or equal to 0.

    • setStartInstant

      public void setStartInstant(int val) throws InvalidArgumentException
      This method sets the starting instant of the resulting video, but it requires that the input file be itself a video of any format supported by ffmpeg.
      Parameters:
      val - The starting instant of the new video
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - when the starting instant of the new video is less than or equal to 0.

    • setCodecID

      public void setCodecID(@NotNull @NotNull String codecID, boolean development) throws InvalidArgumentException, IOException, UnsupportedOperatingSystemException
      This method sets the codec ID of the output video.
      Parameters:
      codecID - The given codec ID
      development - This boolean field tells the method if th user is running the program with a recompiled version of FFmpeg
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - If the given codec ID is null or not supported by ffmpeg
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs
      UnsupportedOperatingSystemException - If the Operating System is not yet supported

    • setAudioCodec

      public void setAudioCodec(@NotNull @NotNull String ac) throws InvalidArgumentException
      This method allows the user to set the audio codec for the resulting video. WARNING: the audio codec should always be compatible with the video codec.
      Parameters:
      ac - The audio codec to be used in the resulting video
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - If the given audio codec is represented by a nul or empty string

    • setVideoQuality

      public void setVideoQuality(int quality)
      This method sets the quality of the output video.
      Parameters:
      quality - The quality of the output video

    • setAudioBitRate

      public void setAudioBitRate(int val) throws InvalidArgumentException
      This method sets the audio track’s bitrate (in Kbit/s).
      Parameters:
      val - The audio track’s bitrate
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - of the given bitrate value is less than or equal to 0

    • setVideoBitRate

      public void setVideoBitRate(int val, @NotNull @NotNull String mode) throws InvalidArgumentException
      This method sets the output video’s bitrate in Kilobits or Megabits.
      Parameters:
      val - The bitrate value
      mode - A value between "k" and "m" (short for Kilobit and Megabit respectively)
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - If the "mode" argument is null, or it is not equal to "k" or "m"

    • setPixelFormat

      public void setPixelFormat(@NotNull @NotNull String pxfmt) throws InvalidArgumentException
      Sets the pixel format.
      Parameters:
      pxfmt - The identifier of the requested pixel format
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - If the given pixel format is null

    • setVideoStreamCopy

      public void setVideoStreamCopy(boolean streamCopy)
      Enables/disables video stream copying.
      Parameters:
      streamCopy - Boolean parameter to enable/disable video stream copying

    • setAudioStreamCopy

      public void setAudioStreamCopy(boolean streamCopy)
      Enables/disables audio stream copying.
      Parameters:
      streamCopy - Boolean parameter to enable/disable audio stream copying

    • setScaleParams

      public void setScaleParams(boolean development, @NotNull @NotNull Scale scale, @Nullable @Nullable ScalingAlgorithm alg, @NotNull @NotNull String width, @NotNull @NotNull String height, @NotNull @NotNull String incolmatname, @NotNull @NotNull String outcolmatname, @NotNull @NotNull String incolrange, @NotNull @NotNull String outcolrange, @NotNull @NotNull String evalSize, @NotNull @NotNull String interlMode, @NotNull @NotNull String forceOAsRatio, int divisibleBy) throws InvalidArgumentException, UnsupportedOperatingSystemException, UnsupportedOperationException
      Sets the "scale" filter parameters.
      Parameters:
      development - A boolean parameter to tell the program if the user is running a custom version of FFmpeg
      scale - The "scale" filter instance
      alg - The ScalingAlgorithm instance
      width - Each frame's width
      height - Each frame's height
      incolmatname - The name of the input color matrix, as described by FFmpeg's documentation of the scaling filter
      outcolmatname - The name of the output color matrix, as described by FFmpeg's documentation of the scaling filter
      incolrange - The input color range
      outcolrange - The output color range
      evalSize - The value that tells when to evaluate the expressions for width and height
      interlMode - The interlacing mode
      forceOAsRatio - A parameter that tells the program whether to force the original aspect ratio
      divisibleBy - An integer that tells the program what the width and height should be divisible by
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - If the given ScalingAlgorithm has an empty string as its name, the with or the height values are null or empty strings, or the pixel format is null or an empty string
      UnsupportedOperatingSystemException - If the user's Operating System is not yet supported by this library
      UnsupportedOperationException - If the video size's id is already set

    • setScaleParamsWithSizeID

      public void setScaleParamsWithSizeID(@NotNull @NotNull Scale scale, @Nullable @Nullable ScalingAlgorithm alg, @NotNull @NotNull String videoSizeID, @NotNull @NotNull String incolmatname, @NotNull @NotNull String outcolmatname, @NotNull @NotNull String incolrange, @NotNull @NotNull String outcolrange, @NotNull @NotNull String evalSize, @NotNull @NotNull String interlMode, @NotNull @NotNull String forceOAsRatio, int divisibleBy) throws InvalidArgumentException, UnsupportedOperationException
      Sets the "scale" filter parameters.
      Parameters:
      scale - The "scale" filter instance
      alg - The ScalingAlgorithm instance
      videoSizeID - A parameter that sets the video size id according to the FFmpeg documentation on this matter
      incolmatname - The name of the input color matrix, as described by FFmpeg's documentation of the scaling filter
      outcolmatname - The name of the output color matrix, as described by FFmpeg's documentation of the scalingù filter
      incolrange - The input color range
      outcolrange - The output color range
      evalSize - The value that tells when to evaluate the expressions for width and height
      interlMode - The interlacing mode
      forceOAsRatio - A parameter that tells the program whether to force the original aspect ratio
      divisibleBy - An integer that tells the program what the width and height should be divisible by
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - If the given ScalingAlgorithm has an empty string as its name
      UnsupportedOperationException - If the video's width and height are already set

    • setFormat

      @Contract("_ -> param1") @NotNull public @NotNull Format setFormat(@NotNull @NotNull Format format) throws InvalidArgumentException
      Sets the parameters of a Format filter instance.
      Parameters:
      format - The given Format filter instance
      Returns:
      The given Format filter instance with all parameters set
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - If the set pixel format is null or an empty string

    • setVideoSimpleFilterGraph

      public void setVideoSimpleFilterGraph(@NotNull @NotNull VideoFilterGraph vfg) throws InvalidArgumentException
      Sets the video simple filter graph.
      Parameters:
      vfg - The given video simple filter graph
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - If the given video simple filter graph is null or not an instance of VideoSimpleFilterGraph or the complex filter graph is not null

    • setAudioSimpleFilterGraph

      public void setAudioSimpleFilterGraph(@NotNull @NotNull AudioFilterGraph afg) throws InvalidArgumentException
      Sets the audio simple filter graph
      Parameters:
      afg - The given audio simple filter graph
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - If the given audio simple filter graph is null or not an instance of AudioSimpleFilterGraph or the complex filter graph is not null

    • setComplexFilterGraph

      public void setComplexFilterGraph(@NotNull @NotNull FilterGraph cfg) throws InvalidArgumentException
      Sets the complex filter graph.
      Parameters:
      cfg - The given complex filter graph
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - If the given complex filter graph is null or the video or audio filter graphs are not null

    • setFPSMode

      public void setFPSMode(@NotNull @NotNull String parameter, String stream_specifier) throws InvalidArgumentException
      Sets the "-fps_mode" option parameters.
      Parameters:
      parameter - The "parameter" value. Cannot be null or empty
      stream_specifier - The "stream_specifier" value. Can be null or empty.
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - If the given "parameter" value is null or an empty string

    • setStreamToMap

      public void setStreamToMap(@NotNull @NotNull String stream) throws InvalidArgumentException
      This method sets a stream to map.
      Parameters:
      stream - The given stream to map. This value cannot be null or an empty string.
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - If the given argument is null or an empty string

    • createCommand

      public void createCommand()
      This method creates the command that, when run, will create the output video. WARNING: all needed filters, filter chains and filter graphs must be set BEFORE calling this method.
